# Rename Columns
rename(data,  new_name = )

```{r}
fires_rename = fires %>% 
  dplyr::select(ID_obj:fire_yr, ECO_NAM:eco_bim, are_km2:eco_cod, locatin:mn_cq_d, mx_cq_d:COMBO, EXTENT:LANDFOR) %>% 
  rename(IDobj = ID_obj, 
         FID = rmpshpr, 
         SIZEm2 = brnd_r_m, 
         SIZEha = brnd_r_h, 
         FireYr = fire_yr, 
         EcoName = ECO_NAM, 
         EcoRlm = eco_rlm, 
         EcoBiom = eco_bim, 
         Ecokm2 = are_km2, 
         EcoCode = eco_cod, 
         ArcSub = locatin, 
         MinDay = min_jln_dt, 
         MaxDay = mx_jln_, 
         AvgDay = men_jln_dt, 
         MedDay = mdn_jl_, 
         MinConf = min_cnfdnc, 
         MaxConf = mx_cnfd, 
         AvgConf = men_cnfdnc, 
         MedConf = mdn_cnf, 
         MinDate = mn_cq_d, 
         MaxDate = mx_cq_d, 
         TotDays = brn_dys, 
         FireId = Fire_ID,  
         Yedoma = yedoma,
         PermCom = COMBO,
         PermExt =  EXTENT,
         PermCon = CONTENT,
         PermLan = LANDFOR)

```

```{r}
fires_rename %>% filter(IDobj ==1451)

```

# Write to shapefile
```{r}
st_write(fires_rename, "../outputs/3.4-Vectors/SiberiaFires_v2_2020.shp", driver="ESRI Shapefile") 
```
